name: enable_simulation
description: If set to false, the simulation will not run. This property will be applied only on component initialization and it can't be changed using the setConfig method. Default value: true

name: polygonal_selector_stroke_color
description: Stroke color for the lasso selection

name: polygonal_selector_line_width
description: Line width for the lasso selection

name: select_point_on_click
description: Controls whether to select a clicked point with the connected points. When `true`: Selects the clicked point and all connected points to it. When `'single'`: Selects only the clicked point. Will also focus (render ring around) the clicked point if `focusPointOnClick` is `undefined`.

name: select_point_on_label_click
description: Controls whether to select a point with the connected points when the point's label is clicked. When `true`: Selects the clicked point and all connected points to it. When `'single'`: Selects only the clicked point. Will also focus (render ring around) the clicked point if `focusPointOnClick` is `undefined`.

name: reset_selection_on_empty_canvas_click
description: Reset selection on empty canvas click. When `true`: Resets the selection when the canvas is clicked and no points are selected. Default value: `true`.

name: focus_point_on_click
description: Controls whether to focus on a point when the point itself is clicked.

name: focus_point_on_label_click
description: Controls whether to focus on a point when the point's label is clicked.

name: components_display_state_mode
description: Controls display state messages behavior for all Cosmograph components. When `undefined`: Show all state messages (loading, no data). When `'loading'`: Show only loading state message, hide no data message. When `false`: Disable all state messages. This will be applied to all components unless explicitly overridden in component-specific configuration. @default `undefined`

name: status_indicator_mode
description: Chooses which kind of status indicator to show during loading or errors. - `'spinner'` (default): show a spinner during loading, falling back to text on errors. - `'text'`: always show descriptive messages. - `false`: hide the status indicator entirely. @default 'spinner'

name: disable_logging
description: Disables logging of Cosmograph messages in the console. Default: `false`

name: preserve_point_positions_on_data_update
description: Preserve positions for points with same ids (`pointIdBy`) during point data update. When `true`: - Points with same ids will stay where they were instead of generating new positions - New points get new positions (or positions from `pointXBy`/`pointYBy` if set) - Preserved positions take priority over new coordinates from `pointXBy`/`pointYBy` for existing points @default false

name: simulation_decay
description: Defines how quickly the simulation cools down.

name: simulation_gravity
description: Coefficient for gravity force.

name: simulation_center
description: Centers the mass force coefficient.

name: simulation_repulsion
description: Configures point repulsion between points.

name: simulation_repulsion_theta
description: Decreases / increases the detalization of the Many-Body force calculations.

name: simulation_repulsion_quadtree_levels
description: Barnes–Hut approximation depth, usable when useQuadtree is set to True.

name: simulation_link_spring
description: Spring constant for links.

name: simulation_link_distance
description: Default distance for links.

name: simulation_link_dist_random_variation_range
description: Random link distance range.

name: simulation_repulsion_from_mouse
description: Mouse position repulsion coefficient, activated by right-click.

name: enable_right_click_repulsion
description: Enable or disable the repulsion force from mouse when right-clicking. When set to `true`, holding the right mouse button will activate the mouse repulsion force. When set to `false`, right-clicking will not trigger any repulsion force. Default value: `false`

name: simulation_friction
description: Sets simulation friction.

name: simulation_cluster
description: Cluster coefficient. Default value: `0.1`.

name: background_color
description: Canvas background color.

name: space_size
description: Size of the simulation space.

name: point_default_color
description: The default color to use for points when no point colors are provided, or if the color value in the array is undefined or null. This can be either a hex color string (e.g., '#b3b3b3') or an array of RGBA values in the format [red, green, blue, alpha] where each value is a number between 0 and 255. Default value: '#b3b3b3'

name: point_greyout_opacity
description: Opacity of unselected nodes during selection.

name: point_greyout_color
description: The color to use for points when they are greyed out (when selection is active). This can be either a hex color string (e.g., '#b3b3b3') or an array of RGBA values in the format [red, green, blue, alpha] where each value is a number between 0 and 255. If not provided, the color will be the same as the point's original color, but darkened or lightened depending on the background color. If point_greyout_opacity is also defined, it will override the alpha/opacity component of this color. Default value: `undefined`

name: point_default_size
description: The default size value to use for points when no point sizes are provided or if the size value in the array is undefined or null. Default value: 4

name: point_size_scale
description: Scale factor for point sizes.

name: point_opacity
description: Universal opacity value applied to all points. This value multiplies with individual point alpha values (if set via setPointColors). Useful for dynamically controlling opacity of all points without updating individual RGBA arrays. Default value: `1.0`

name: hovered_point_cursor
description: Cursor type when hovering over a point.

name: render_hovered_point_ring
description: Enables ring around hovered points.

name: hovered_point_ring_color
description: Color of hovered point ring.

name: focused_point_ring_color
description: Color of the focused point ring.

name: focused_point_index
description: Index of the focused point, prioritized over focus_point method.

name: render_links
description: Enables or disables link rendering.

name: link_default_color
description: The default color to use for links when no link colors are provided, or if the color value in the array is undefined or null. This can be either a hex color string (e.g., '#666666') or an array of RGBA values in the format [red, green, blue, alpha] where each value is a number between 0 and 255. Default value: '#666666'

name: link_greyout_opacity
description: Opacity of unselected links during selection.

name: link_default_width
description: The default width value to use for links when no link widths are provided or if the width value in the array is undefined or null. Default value: 1

name: link_width_scale
description: Scale factor for link widths.

name: link_opacity
description: Universal opacity value applied to all links. This value multiplies with individual link alpha values (if set via setLinkColors). Useful for dynamically controlling opacity of all links without updating individual RGBA arrays. Default value: `1.0`

name: hovered_link_color
description: The color to use for links when they are hovered. This can be either a hex color string (e.g., '#ff3333') or an array of RGBA values in the format [red, green, blue, alpha] where each value is a number between 0 and 255. Default value: `undefined`

name: hovered_link_width_increase
description: Number of pixels to add to the link width when hovered. The hovered width is calculated as: originalWidth + hoveredLinkWidthIncrease. Default value: `5`

name: hovered_link_cursor
description: Cursor style to use when hovering over a link. Default value: `auto`

name: curved_links
description: Enables or disables curved links.

name: curved_link_segments
description: Segments defining curved links.

name: curved_link_weight
description: Weight factor for link curvature.

name: curved_link_control_point_distance
description: Control point positioning for curves.

name: link_default_arrows
description: The default value to use for link arrows when no link arrow data is provided. If set to `true`, all links will have arrows by default. If set to `false`, links will not have arrows unless specified via `link_arrow_by`. Default value: `false`

name: link_arrows_size_scale
description: Scale factor for link arrow size.

name: link_visibility_distance_range
description: Pixel distance range for link transparency.

name: link_visibility_min_transparency
description: Minimum transparency of links based on link_visibility_distance_range.

name: use_classic_quadtree
description: Use the classic quadtree algorithm for the Many-Body force. This property will be applied only on component initialization and it can't be changed using the setConfig method. Default value: `false`

name: show_fps_monitor
description: Display an FPS counter in the upper right corner of the canvas.

name: pixel_ratio
description: Canvas pixel ratio.

name: scale_points_on_zoom
description: Scales point sizes when zooming.

name: scale_links_on_zoom
description: Increase or decrease the size of the links when zooming in or out.

name: initial_zoom_level
description: Starting zoom level.

name: enable_zoom
description: Enables or disables zooming in and out. Default: `true`

name: enable_simulation_during_zoom
description: Controls whether the simulation remains active during zoom operations. When set to `true`, the simulation continues running while zooming. When set to `false`, the simulation pauses during zoom operations. Default value: `false`

name: enable_drag
description: Allows graph dragging.

name: fit_view_on_init
description: Automatically fits view to all points upon initialization.

name: fit_view_delay
description: Delay for fitting view after initialization in milliseconds.

name: fit_view_padding
description: Padding around fit view area.

name: fit_view_duration
description: Animation duration for view fitting in milliseconds.

name: fit_view_by_points_in_rect
description: Fits view to specified rectangle of points, active when fit_view_on_init is True.

name: fit_view_by_point_indices
description: When `fit_view_on_init` is set to `true`, fits the view to show only the specified points by their indices. Takes precedence over `fit_view_by_points_in_rect` when both are provided. Default: `undefined`

name: random_seed
description: Seed value for generating random numbers in simulations.

name: point_sampling_distance
description: Distance threshold for sampling points.

name: rescale_positions
description: Controls automatic position adjustment of points in the visible space. When `undefined` (default): If simulation is disabled (`enableSimulation: false`), points will be automatically repositioned to fit within the visible space. If simulation is enabled, points will not be rescaled. When explicitly set: `true`: Forces points positions to be rescaled. `false`: Forces points positions to not be rescaled.

name: point_color_palette
description: An optional array of color strings that can be used to color the points in the visualization. If provided, the points will be colored using the colors in this palette, cycling through the array as needed. Used when point_color_strategy is set to `'categorical'`, `'continuous'`, `'degree'`, `'preciseDegree'`, or `'linkDirection'`.

name: point_color_by_map
description: An optional mapping of values to colors for the points in the visualization. The keys in the map should be string and the values can be either color strings or arrays of RGBA values. Used when point_color_strategy is set to `'map'`.

name: point_color_strategy
description: Specifies the strategy for coloring points based on data from the point_color_by column. Available strategies: `undefined` (default): Automatically uses the optimal strategy based on input configuration and color data type. Current strategy can be acquired with cosmograph.activePointColorStrategy. All strategies use `unknown_color` for nullish/unparseable values (null, undefined, 'null', '', 'undefined', 'nan'). `'categorical'`: Uses colors from point_color_palette without interpolation. For numeric data: Creates equal-width buckets mapped to point_color_palette colors. For categorical data: Assigns colors from point_color_palette in order, cycling when unique values exceed palette length. Uses unknown_color for nullish values. Has effect only if point_color_by provided. `'continuous'`: Interpolates colors from point_color_palette. For numeric data: Creates continuous color scale between point_color_palette colors. For categorical data: Creates evenly-spaced color scale by interpolating between point_color_palette colors to match the number of unique values so every value is a unique color. Uses unknown_color for nullish values. Has effect only if point_color_by provided. `'map'`: Uses color mapping from point_color_by_map to values in point_color_by. Applies exact color from point_color_by_map for matching values. Falls back to unknown_color when value is not found in map or invalid. Has effect only if point_color_by_map and point_color_by provided. `'degree'`: Colors points based on their degree (number of connections) using interpolated point_color_palette with quantile-based boundaries. Maps point degrees to continuous color scale between point_color_palette colors. Minimum and maximum values are clamped to 5th and 95th percentiles of total degree distribution. Has effect only if links provided. `'preciseDegree'`: Colors points based on their degree (number of connections) using interpolated point_color_palette without quantile-based boundaries. Maps point degrees to continuous color scale between point_color_palette colors. Has effect only if links provided. `'linkDirection'`: Colors points based on their link direction (in, out, bidirectional, isolated) using point_color_palette. Has effect only if links provided. `'direct'`: Directly uses point_color_by column values as colors. Applies the color if it's a valid color string (hex, rgb, named color, etc) or an array of [r, g, b, a]. If point_color_by_fn exists, applies it to transform point_color_by values into custom colors. Falls back to unknown_color if invalid color. If neither point_color_by nor point_color_by_fn exist, colors all points with unknown_color. `'single'`: Colors all points uniformly to the same color specified by point_color.

name: unknown_color
description: The color to use for points and links when their data is unknown and the current coloring strategy cannot resolve it. Used for nullish/unparseable values (null, undefined, 'null', '', 'undefined', 'nan'), invalid color values, missing map entries, or when no color data is available. Default: 'rgba(205, 207, 213, 0.9)' (light gray with 90% opacity).

name: point_size_strategy
description: Specifies the strategy for sizing points based on data from the point_size_by column.

name: cluster_positions_map
description: Mapping of cluster keys to [x, y] coordinate positions. Keys should match values from the pointClusterBy column. Missing cluster keys will be automatically positioned using the centermass. Won't take effect if point positions are provided by pointXBy or pointYBy. @example Object mapping cluster keys to coordinates: clusterPositionsMap: { 'Rock': [10, 20], 'Rap': [30, 40] }

name: point_include_columns
description: An array of additional column names to include in point data.

name: point_timeline_by
description: Column to determine values for the point timeline. Shows a point timeline if set.

name: link_color_palette
description: An optional array of color strings that can be used to color the links in the visualization. If provided, the links will be colored using the colors in this palette, cycling through the array as needed. Used when link_color_strategy is set to `'categorical'`, `'sum'`, `'average'`, or `'count'`.

name: link_color_strategy
description: Specifies the strategy for coloring links based on data from the link_color_by column. When `undefined` (default), will automatically use the optimal strategy based on the input configuration and color data type. Current strategy can be acquired with cosmograph.activeLinkColorStrategy. Available strategies: `'sum'`: Uses the sum of numeric values between the same source and target points in link_color_by to determine link colors and interpolates them from link_color_palette. Uses unknown_color for nullish values. Has effect only if link_color_by provided and contains numeric data. `'average'`: Uses the average of numeric values between the same source and target points in link_color_by to determine link colors and interpolates them from link_color_palette. Uses unknown_color for nullish values. Has effect only if link_color_by provided and contains numeric data. `'count'`: Uses the count of links between the same source and target points in link_color_by to determine link colors and interpolates them from link_color_palette. `'categorical'`: Uses colors from link_color_palette for link_color_by data without interpolation. For numeric data: Creates equal-width buckets mapped to link_color_palette colors. For categorical data: Assigns colors from link_color_palette in order, cycling when unique values exceed palette length. Uses unknown_color for nullish values. Has effect only if link_color_by provided. `'direct'`: Directly uses link_color_by column values as colors. Applies the color if it's a valid color string (hex, rgb, named color, etc) or an array of [r, g, b, a]. If link_color_by_fn exists, applies it to transform link_color_by values into custom colors. Falls back to unknown_color if invalid color. If neither link_color_by nor link_color_by_fn exist, colors all links with unknown_color. `'single'`: Colors all links uniformly to the same color specified by link_default_color. This is the default strategy when no link_color_by is provided.

name: link_width_strategy
description: Specifies the strategy for sizing links based on data from the link_width_by column. When `undefined` (default), will automatically use the optimal strategy based on the input configuration and width data type. Current strategy can be acquired with cosmograph.activeLinkWidthStrategy. Available strategies: `'sum'`: Uses the sum of numeric values between the same source and target points in link_width_by to determine link widths and interpolates them from link_width_range. Has effect only if link_width_by provided and contains numeric data. `'average'`: Uses the average of numeric values between the same source and target points in link_width_by to determine link widths and interpolates them from link_width_range. Has effect only if link_width_by provided and contains numeric data. `'count'`: Uses the count of links between the same source and target points in link_width_by to determine link widths and interpolates them from link_width_range. `'direct'`: Directly uses link_width_by column values as widths. Treats numeric values in link_width_by as link widths in pixels 1:1 without interpolation if they are numbers. If link_width_by_fn exists, applies it to transform link_width_by values into custom widths. Falls back to link_default_width if invalid width. If neither link_width_by nor link_width_by_fn exist, sets all links width to link_default_width. `'single'`: Sets all links width to the same value specified by link_default_width. This is the default strategy when no link_width_by is provided.

name: link_width_range
description: Defines the range for automatic link width scaling. Takes [min, max] values in pixels. When link_width_by column contains numeric values, they will be automatically remapped to fit within this range to prevent oversized links if no link_width_by_fn provided.

name: link_include_columns
description: An array of additional column names to include in link data.

name: link_timeline_by
description: Column to determine values for the link timeline. Shows a timeline for links if set.

name: show_dynamic_labels
description: Flag to show dynamic labels for visible points.

name: show_labels_for
description: An array of point ids for which to show labels.

name: show_top_labels
description: Flag to display labels for the top points.

name: show_top_labels_limit
description: Maximum number of top points to show labels for.

name: show_cluster_labels
description: Show labels for the clusters based on the `pointClusterBy` column. When any point is selected, cluster labels will be hidden until the selection is cleared.

name: point_label_color
description: Specifies the CSS color to use for the point labels.

name: point_label_font_size
description: Specifies the font size to use for the point labels.

name: cluster_label_font_size
description: Specifies the font size to use for the cluster labels.

name: scale_cluster_labels
description: Whether to scale the cluster labels based on the number of points in the cluster.

name: static_label_weight
description: Specifies the weight of the static labels.

name: dynamic_label_weight
description: Specifies the weight of the dynamic labels.

name: label_margin
description: Specifies the margin between the label and the point.

name: label_padding
description: Specifies the [left, top, right, bottom] padding of the label element.

name: custom_labels
description: Specifies an array of custom labels to be displayed on the Cosmograph canvas. Each custom label is a dictionary with the following optional properties: `text` (string, required): The label text. `position` (list[float] of length 2, required): The [x, y] position of the label in space coordinates. `className` (string, optional): CSS class name for the label. `color` (string, optional): CSS color for the label. `weight` (float, optional): Label weight between 0 and 1. `fontSize` (float, optional): Font size in pixels. `style` (string, optional): CSS style string. `padding` (dict, optional): Padding object with `left`, `top`, `right`, `bottom` properties. `maxWidth` (float, optional): Maximum width of the label in pixels.

name: use_point_color_strategy_for_cluster_labels
description: If `true`, cluster labels will acquire colors from the current point coloring strategy (`pointColorStrategy`). This can be useful when `pointClusterBy` and `pointColorBy` refer to the same data. Default: `false`

name: select_cluster_on_label_click
description: Controls whether to select points of a cluster when its label is clicked.

name: show_hovered_point_label
description: Whether to show a hovered point label.

name: points
description: Data in a pandas DataFrame format.

name: links
description: Data in a pandas DataFrame format.

name: api_key
description: API key for authenticating with Cosmograph services. Can be set globally using set_api_key() function.
